alert.note: Alert for Washington (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 08 at 3:34AM EDT until May 08 at 9:33AM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...Observed flooding changed to Minor severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Maryland... Conococheague Creek at Fairview affecting Washington County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Conococheague Creek at Fairview. * WHEN...Until late this morning. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Wishard Road and Kemp Mill Road are both flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:46 AM EDT Sunday the stage was 10.1 feet, or 0.1 feet above flood stage. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 2:46 AM EDT Sunday was 10.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage early this morning and continue falling to 4.5 feet early Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.1 feet on 04/15/1970. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && River Name Fld Observed Sun Sun Sun Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time 8AM 2PM 8PM Stg Time Date Conococheague Creek Fairview 10.0 10.1 Sun 2 am 9.5 8.8 8.2 MSG unknown &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/washington or www.weather.gov/baltimore. The next statement will be issued this morning at 945 AM EDT.
